 30 -class PositionEstimator(object): 

 31      """ 
 32      Base class for position estimation algorithms. 
 33   
 34      A position estimator takes data from IMUs on a jointed rigid body and 
 35      updates the root position of a L{SampledBodyModel}. 
 36      """ 
 37      __metaclass__ = ABCMeta 
 38   

 39 -    def __init__(self, model, initialTime=0, initialPosition=np.zeros((3,1))): 

 40          """ 
 41          Initialise position estimator. 
 42   
 43          @param model: L{SampledBodyModel} to update. 
 44          @param initialTime: The time at which the the initialPosition is 
 45              sampled 
 46          @param initialPosition: Initial position vector (3x1 L{np.ndarray}). 
 47          """ 
 48          self._model = model 
 49          self._model.positionKeyFrames.add(initialTime, initialPosition) 

 50   

 51 -    def __call__(self, data, t): 

 52          """ 
 53          Update the position of the model given the current model state 
 54          and additional data. 
 55   
 56          @param data: Data from IMUs attached to the body , as a list of 
 57              L{dict} objects. E.g. these may be L{RadioPacket} objects with 
 58              data trasmitted by each IMU. 
 59          @param t: The time at which to compute the update (float). 
 60          """ 
 61          dt = t - self._model.positionKeyFrames.latestTime 
 62          position, covariance = self._update(data, dt, t) 
 63          self._model.positionKeyFrames.add(t, position, covariance) 

 64   
 65      @abstractmethod 

 66 -    def _update(self, data, dt, t): 

 67          """ 
 68          Internal method to be implemented by subclasses. 
 69   
 70          @param data: Data from sensors attached to the body model, as a list 
 71              of L{dict} objects. E.g. these may be L{RadioPacket} objects 
 72              with data trasmitted by each IMU. 
 73          @param dt: Time elapsed since the last update. 
 74          @param t: The time for which to compute the update (float). 
 75          """ 
 76          pass 

 77   

 78 -    def getParameter(self, data, jointName, parameter, default=None): 

 79          """ 
 80          Get a named parameter for a joint from the passed data tuple. 
 81   
 82          @param data: List or tuple of data objects from sensors attached 
 83              to the body model. Data objects are assumed to have a 'jointName' 
 84              attribute with the name of the associated joint and parameters as 
 85              other named attributes e.g. 'acceleration'. 
 86          @param jointName: The joint name to get data for (string). 
 87          @param parameter: The name of the parameter to get data for (string). 
 88          @param default: Default parameter value to return if the parameter is 
 89              not found in the passed data. 
 90   
 91          @return: The requested parameter value, or default value if the 
 92              parameter is not found in the passed data. 
 93          """ 
 94          for item in data: 
 95              if item.has_key('jointName') and item['jointName'] == jointName: 
 96                  return item.get(parameter, default)

117 -    def __init__(self, model, initialTime=0, initialPosition=np.zeros((3,1)),

122          @param integrationMethod: L{Integrator} to use for position integration.

139 -    def __init__(self, model, initialTime=0, initialPosition=np.zeros((3,1)),

144   

145 -    def _lowestPoint(self, t): 

146          key = lambda point: point.position(t)[2] 
147          return sorted([p for p in self._model.points if 
148              not np.any(np.isnan(p.position(t)))], key=key)[-1] 

149   

150 -    def _update(self, data, dt, t): 

151          lowest = self._lowestPoint(t) 
152          if self._anchor is not lowest: 
153              self._anchorPosition += (lowest.position(t) - 
154                  self._anchor.position(t)) 
155              self._anchorPosition[2] = 0 
156              self._anchor = lowest 
157   
158          return self._anchorPosition + (self._model.position(t) - 
159                  self._anchor.position(t)), None

161 -class ContactTrackingKalmanFilter(PositionEstimator): 

162      """ 
163      Estimates position based on root acceleration and estimated ground contact. 
164      """ 
165   
166      @prepend_method_doc(PositionEstimator) 

167 -    def __init__(self, model, initialTime=0, 
168              initialPosition=np.zeros((3,1)), 
169              initialVelocity=np.zeros((3,1)), 
170              accelerationVar=0.2, velocityVar=0.5, 
171              rejectionProbabilityThreshold=0.4, 
172              **kwargs): 

173          """ 
174          @param initialVelocity: Initial velocity estimate (3x1 L{np.ndarray}) 
175          @param accelerationVar: Acceleration variance (float). 
176          @param velocityVar: Velocity variance (float). 
177          @param rejectionProbabilityThreshold: Probability below which a 
178              velocity update will be rejected (float, 0 <= p <= 1) 
179          """ 
180          PositionEstimator.__init__(self, model, initialTime, initialPosition) 
181   
182          self._accelerationSigma = math.sqrt(accelerationVar) 
183          self._measurementVariance = np.diag([velocityVar]*3) 
184          self._rejectionThreshold = rejectionProbabilityThreshold 
185   
186          self._points = list(model.points) 
187          for point in self._points: 
188              point.contactProbabilities = TimeSeries() 
189   
190          self.kalman = KalmanFilter( 
191                  stateTransitionMatrix = self.transitionMatrix(1), 
192                  controlMatrix = self.controlMatrix(1), 
193                  measurementMatrix = np.hstack((np.zeros((3,3)),np.eye(3))), 
194                  state = np.vstack((initialPosition,initialVelocity)), 
195                  stateCovariance = self.processCovariance(1), 
196                  processCovariance = self.processCovariance(1), 
197                  measurementCovariance = self._measurementVariance) 

198   

199 -    def _update(self, data, dt, t): 

200          acceleration = self.getParameter(data, self._model.name, 
201                  'linearAcceleration', default=np.zeros((3,1))) 
202   
203          self.kalman.stateTransitionMatrix = self.transitionMatrix(dt) 
204          self.kalman.controlMatrix = self.controlMatrix(dt) 
205          self.kalman.processCovariance = self.processCovariance(dt) 
206   
207          self.kalman.predict(acceleration) 
208   
209          velocity, probability = self.estimateVelocityProbabilities(dt, t) 
210          if probability > self._rejectionThreshold: 
211              self.kalman.correct(velocity) 
212   
213          return self.kalman.state[:3], self.kalman.stateCovariance[:3, :3] 

214   

215 -    def estimateVelocityProbabilities(self, dt, t): 

216          """ 
217          Estimate the possible velocities (and probabilities) of the model. 
218   
219          Estimates are based on the assumption that a point is stationary 
220          in world co-ordinates in the interval `[t-dt,t]` 
221   
222          @return: The velocity with the highest probabilty of not being wrong 
223          """ 
224          vPredicted = self.kalman.state[3:] 
225          inv_cov = self.kalman.stateCovariance[3:6,3:6].I 
226   
227          highestProbability = 0 
228   
229          for point in self._points: 
230              vHat = -(point.position(t) - point.position(t-dt)) / dt 
231              vError = vHat - vPredicted 
232              mahalanobis_distance = np.sqrt(vError.T * inv_cov * vError) 
233              probability = 2 * scipy.stats.norm.cdf(-mahalanobis_distance) 
234              if probability > highestProbability: 
235                  highestProbability = probability 
236                  estimatedVelocity = vHat 
237              point.contactProbabilities.add(t, probability[0,0]) 
238   
239          return estimatedVelocity, highestProbability 

240   

241 -    def transitionMatrix(self, dt): 

242          A = np.matrix([ [1, 0, 0, dt, 0, 0], 
243                          [0, 1, 0, 0, dt, 0], 
244                          [0, 0, 1, 0, 0, dt], 
245                          [0, 0, 0, 1, 0, 0 ], 
246                          [0, 0, 0, 0, 1, 0 ], 
247                          [0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 1 ]]) 
248          return A 

249   

250 -    def controlMatrix(self, dt): 

251          a = 0.5 * dt**2 
252          b = dt 
253          B = np.matrix([ [a, 0, 0], 
254                          [0, a, 0], 
255                          [0, 0, a], 
256                          [b, 0, 0], 
257                          [0, b, 0], 
258                          [0, 0, b]]) 
259          return B 

260   

261 -    def processCovariance(self, dt): 

262          a = (0.5 * dt**2)**2 * self._accelerationSigma**2 
263          b = ((0.5 * dt**2) * self._accelerationSigma) * (dt * 
264                  self._accelerationSigma) 
265          c = dt**2 * self._accelerationSigma**2 
266   
267          Q = np.matrix([ [a, 0, 0, b, 0, 0], 
268                          [0, a, 0, 0, b, 0], 
269                          [0, 0, a, 0, 0, b], 
270                          [b, 0, 0, c, 0, 0], 
271                          [0, b, 0, 0, c, 0], 
272                          [0, 0, b, 0, 0, c]]) 
273          return Q
